normalised: I am often asked how to address letters to various government and institutional offices in India. It seems simple, but the format does matter, especially for ensuring your mail reaches the right department and person quickly. Generally, you will want to start with the recipient's name or designation, if you know it. For instance, "The Director" or "Shri R. K. Sharma, I-A-S". Then, below that, you would write the name of the office or department, like "Department of Education" or "Municipal Corporation of Delhi".
